entry.title: Review: Rage Of The Dragons NEO (Switch) - A Fabulous Version Of A Fantastic Fighter
entry.summary: Hey! Broom heads! With the original Double Dragon, Yoshihisa Kishimoto realised a dramatic, violent expedition to save a kidnapped girl from a miscreant petrol gang. Although the genre had already been established by Irem‚Äôs Kung-Fu Master several years earlier, the scores of enemies, weapons, multi-plane scenery, two-player functionality, and broad range of attacks made it the biggest arcade smash of 1987. Although its direct sequels were lacklustre, 1995's Double Dragon for the Neo Geo (a fighting game spin-off often known as Double Dragon ‚Äô95 to differentiate) was notable. Designed to tie in with the questionable US-produced Double Dragon movie, it remains a very good game. Difficult, perhaps, with thankless AI, but the mechanics and balancing saw it played competitively far and wide. Sadly, the series didn‚Äôt revisit the fighting game format until 2002, when Rage of the Dragons surfaced as a late Neo Geo contender. Originally meant to be a sequel to the aforementioned 1995 release, licensing issues had Rage of the Dragons end up outside of canon despite featuring two brothers named Billy and Jimmy‚Ä¶ Lewis. Its roots, however, are obvious, and it's still recognised by many as being part of the overall Double Dragon universe. Read the full article on nintendolife.com

entry.title: Noble simulator Norland gets a map overhaul with Patch 26
entry.summary:
Hooded Horse has announced that Long Jaunt‚Äôs noble family management game, Norland, has reached Patch 26. This one might be the largest yet, as it adds family trees, new NPCs, and ‚Äì perhaps most notably ‚Äì an overhaul to the world map.
Norland launched into early access in kind of rough shape. The framework was there, but I found it to be unbalanced and required too much juggling to really enjoy. As I described it in my early access review, none of its facets have any time to breathe, leading to things breaking down.
Since the time I played it, the devs have been hitting it hard and fast with updates to address player concerns. The gusto is admirable. I haven‚Äôt jumped back into the game since my initial encounter, but I have seen certain tweaks that seem like they would make things more palatable. Things like cutting down on the amount of babysitting the peasants need.
Image via Hooded Horse
Here‚Äôs what information I have on the update: ‚ÄúThe latest update for Norland completely overhauls the world map with new sprites, more topology, and more regional diversity. Players will start each game battling for control over a single region before transitioning to the ‚Äúworld‚Äù stage and fighting over nation-states of different cultures. The overall map size is also bigger now, and a previous patch allows players to compel nearby vassals to tackle distant issues, freeing their own nobles to focus on matters closer to home.‚Äù
On top of that, an added family tree means you can keep track of your lineage so that, I don‚Äôt know, you can keep second cousins from marrying each other. If you can stop them. There are also new ‚Äúguest‚Äù NPC characters such as cultists and pilgrims. I‚Äôm not sure why ‚Äúguest‚Äù is in quotes, but that‚Äôs how it is in the press release.
Norland is currently in Early Access and available on PC. Also, it's on sale for 35% until December 4, 2024.
The post Noble simulator Norland gets a map overhaul with Patch 26 appeared first on Destructoid.

entry.title: Infinity Nikki global release date locked in for December 5
entry.summary:
Over 30 million players have pre-registered for the latest entry in the Nikki series, and the release date is finally in place. You'll be able to leap into Miraland and dress up all fancy when Infinity Nikki launches worldwide on December 5, 2024.
Following up on last month's closed beta, Infinity Nikki has its sights set on PlayStation 5, PC, and iOS and Android devices. You can see some of the colorful open world and sample pop artist Jessie J's theme song, "Together Til Infinity," in the release date trailer below.
Kentaro Tominaga‚Äîwho previously worked on Nintendo titles like The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom, among others‚Äîis at the helm for this one. Infinity Nikki lets players explore the world of Miraland, taking on puzzles, digging up secrets, and putting on their fiercest duds for fashion contests.¬†
There are other characters to meet, and story quests to accept along the way. It all looks and sounds like a pretty pleasant little adventure, with more dress than stress on the menu. If you didn't get a chance to see how it plays during the recent beta, you'll be able to set out on this delightfully poppy adventure early next month.¬†
And yes, that song is going to be in my head for the rest of the day, too. It's definitely fitting for something that bills itself as "the coziest open-world game."
The post Infinity Nikki global release date locked in for December 5 appeared first on Destructoid.

entry.title: Sakuna: of Rice and Ruin reveals new spin-off, mobile game, and anime sequel
entry.summary:
Fans of Sakuna: Of Rice and Ruin are eating good today. Three separate new projects were revealed for the series, including a mobile game, a new console game, and an anime sequel.¬†
The rice-growing action-RPG that started it all first launched in 2020, with XSEED Games and Marvelous publishing the Edelweiss-developed title. It went on to inspire a TV anime adaptation, which ran for 13 episodes starting in July 2024. The anime is currently streaming on Crunchyroll and Netflix, and more is in the works.
Details on the anime sequel are about as light as the games. Masayuki Yoshihara (The Eccentric Family) directed the first season, with Jukki Hanada (Nichijou, Sound! Euphonium) writing and Mio Fujishima handling character designs for the P.A. Works production. So far, we just have teaser art by original character designer Ryota Murayama, with one character visual representing each of the three projects.¬†
The new console game is a spin-off titled Sakuna Chronicles: Kokorowa and the Gears of Creation. Edelweiss is handling development once again, and XSEED Games already announced plans to publish the new entry in North America. According to the press release, this story follows Sakuna's close friend Princess Kokorowa, a "high-ranking goddess presiding over wheels and inventions from her heavenly home."
Check out a brief teaser:
This all comes hot on the heels of the first game's fourth anniversary, which fell on November 12. Hopefully, we'll learn more about all three projects soon.¬†
The post Sakuna: of Rice and Ruin reveals new spin-off, mobile game, and anime sequel appeared first on Destructoid.

entry.title: Sorry We're Closed review: old school survival horror with plenty of heart
entry.summary: Sorry We're Closed is a retro survival horror-inspired game about escaping the clutches of an excessively horny demon who desperately wants your heart. As someone who isn't often into the 'lore' behind things and prefers to just shoot and ask questions later, I found myself actually asking the questions. I wanted to know why I was targeted by such carnal eroticism. I wanted to know more about my character's own relationships. How angels fit into the picture. And why lots of the demons seem quite chill, really. But when it came to the actual survival - the bit I thought I'd enjoy the most - I came away a bit disappointed. Exploration is fine, it's just the combat is often too frequent and too frequently irritating. I came to dread the action more than the atmosphere, in the end. Read more

The current expansion of Hearthstone is titled "The Great Dark Beyond." It focuses on the Draenei's adventures through space. It's made for some great art, but ultimately, it's a fairly "okay" set at best. The starships aren't terribly fun to play with, the balance is awful, and the general design feels very haphazard. entry.title: Oshi no Ko‚Äôs writer, Aka Akasaka, is already working on a new manga
entry.summary:
The award-winning manga Oshi no Ko, created by the joint effort of the writer Aka Akasaka and the artist Mengo Yokoyari, just released its final chapter. However, fans of the series already have something to look forward to. The 50th issue of Shueisha's Young Jump magazine announced that Aka Akasaka is already working on a new manga.
Anime News Network reports that Aka Akasaka will be working with Record of Ragnarok's Ajichika and Greek Circle Crisis' Aoi Kujira. Furthermore, the new manga series will be released in the same magazine. The story reportedly follows the love story of a prince and a princess in a fairy tale setting.
A teaser image for the new manga has also been released.
Image via @oricon_anime_
About Aka Akasaka
Aka Akasaka made his manga debut in 2015 with Kaguya-sama: Love is War. At the time, it was being published on Miracle Jump. The series was later transferred to Weekly Young Jump where it ultimately saw its conclusion in November 2022. But while the series was still in publication, Akasaka already started working on Oshi no Ko with Mengo Yokoyari.
The two titles were serialized at the same time since April 2020, which meant Akasaka was working on two titles at once. That set-up may have possibly worked for him. After Kaguya-sama: Love is War ended in 2022, Akasaka announced his retirement from drawing manga. In April 2023, he worked with Nishizawa 5mm to release yet another manga series, Renai Daiko. Renai Daiko ran from April 2023 to June 2024.
Despite working on multiple series at once, Akasaka's works are not unloved. Kaguya-sama: Love is War won the Next Manga Award for print manga, the 65th Shogakukan Manga Award for the general manga category, and the grand prize of the BookWalker Awards. Meanwhile, Oshi no Ko was also a winner of the Next Manga Award.
The post Oshi no Ko‚Äôs writer, Aka Akasaka, is already working on a new manga appeared first on Destructoid.

entry.title: Gran Saga tier list of best characters (Launch)
entry.summary:
Gran Saga's global launch, which happened a couple of weeks ago, has introduced the new gacha to mobiles and PC.
It's a free-to-play title that can be played on your handheld, or you could choose to download it via PC. Like every good gacha, there's a tier list of all the characters currently available inside the game. This tier list will help you to sort out your early team, and invest the resources efficiently.
Gran Saga tier list
I have kept three tiers to classify the characters. In Gran Saga, you can potentially use any character currently available to build your team.
S-tier: Strong characters who should be future-proof for the power curve.
A-tier: Decent characters who can be as good as S-tier in certain situations.
B-tier: Good characters who will need a lot of time and investment to reach the late-game stages.
In Gran Saga, characters also have their own elemental type, and it's important to make a squad well-balanced in general to cover the strengths and weaknesses.
Gran Saga S-tier list
Quyi
Seriade
Fuxiao
Hilda
Orta
Jun
Gran Saga A-tier list

Christina
Yuna
Mikokoro
Ivan
Kaito

Wyin
Leon
Karte
Gran Saga B-tier list
Karcion
Ignox
Namarie
Luin
While it's still early days, I would prefer to build a team with a single type of damage. In simpler words, it's better to go for either a full-magic team, or a full-physical. It's not easy as you won't have the top-tier names from both types immediately after starting the game. That said, the pulls have so far been pretty generous, so making a top team won't be a difficult ask at all.

entry.title: Doom rebuilt in the Age of Empires engine? Sure, why not
entry.summary:
I never thought I'd see the day when I would reach my forties (laugh it up) and Doom would still be relevant in the gaming sphere. With The Dark Ages coming sometime in 2025, id Software's influential shooter franchise is still as strong as ever.
To say nothing of the modding community, which has been tweaking and tinkering with the classics since time immemorial. Most fan-made content may change much about the originals, but will typically keep it feeling like a traditional Doom game. However, one person decided to switch things up a bit.
ModDB user HELLKNIGHT61 thought it was high-time to remove the "FP" from "first-person shooter" and deliver a version of Doom that's more isometric. More specifically, they've taken the 1993 game and rebuilt it in the Age of Empires 2 engine, turning it into some sort of classic PC gaming amalgamation.
Rip 'n' tear 'n' wololo
Now, before I go any further, I am aware that "Age of DOOM" came out a year ago. According to the download page, it was released on November 9, 2023. However, it seems to have wormed its way onto the first couple of pages of ModDB and, honestly, I'm genuinely surprised I haven't come across this one already.
HELLKNIGHT61 describes the mod as both a "tactical shooter and isometric shooter game," with some point 'n' click elements to boot. Simply put: it takes the sprites and visuals from Doom (as well as the ultra violent Brutal Doom mod) and incorporates them into Age of Empire 2's otherwise green and pleasant lands.
It's also standalone, which means you don't need either of the official games in order to play "Age of DOOM." It features a tutorial scenario, a practice scenario, as well as a remake of the "Knee Deep in the Dead" chapter, which has nine maps. It's also recommended to start with the tutorial, because a fast-paced shooter in an isometric world with tactical elements may not have the most intuitive gameplay.
The post Doom rebuilt in the Age of Empires engine? Sure, why not appeared first on Destructoid.

To celebrate his achievements, EA Sports has released a special card that can be obtained in Ultimate Team. Let's look at how you can complete this challenge in Ultimate Team and if you should invest your resources to unlock this card.
EA FC 25 Mario Retegui Serie A POTM SBC tasks
The Mario Retegui Serie A POTM SBC has three different tasks in Ultimate Team. Here's how you can complete the challenge.
Task 1 - Italy
Min. 1 Players from: Italy
Min. 1 Players: Team of the Week
Min. Team Rating: 81
Task 2 - Serie A
Min. 1 Players from: Serie A TIM
Min. 1 Players: Team of the Week
Min. Team Rating: 82
Task 3 - Top Form
Min. 1 Players: Team of the Week
Min. Team Rating: 83
EA FC 25 Mario Retegui Serie A POTM SBC solutions
Here's a set of solutions you can use to obtain the item.
Task 1 - Italy
Any 80-rated TOTW item
Any 9 81-rated items
Bonansea 82
Task 2 - Serie A
Any 9 82-rated items
Bonansea 82
Any 81-rated item
Task 3 - Top Form
Any 10 83-rated item
Any 82-rated TOTW item
Should you complete the Mario Retegui Serie A POTM SBC?
Here are the key stats of the new card.
Attributes Ratings
Overall 87
Shooting 89
Passing 79
Dribbling 85
Defense 49
Pace 87
Physicality 88
The greatest weakness of this card is the lack of a role at Advanced Forward. However, it's a great choice for those who love playing a Target Man up front. The card has Target Man++, and First Touch+. It also offers Power Shot and Press Proven playstyle, which are extremely useful. I just wish that the SBC didn't require three TOTW items, which unnecessarily drive up the completion cost of this challenge.

entry.title: Rue Valley is sending the nattering inner voices of Disco Elysium to therapy
entry.summary: In Rue Valley you role play a guy with poor mental health. He wanders around a crappy motel, stuck in the same old patterns of life, seemingly unable to escape his inner demons. When confronted with the premise for this upcoming RPG you may have one of two reactions. The first: you will say "lol, it me" with enough humour to wishlist it on Steam and earmark it for the future. The second: you will mutter "ugh, it me" and be immediately put off by the idea of having to tolerate an entire second layer of psychological hangups. There is a third secret reaction though... you might think: oh, this looks a lot like Disco Elysium, but in the real world. Read more

entry.title: How to water both plants in Life is Strange: Double Exposure (Thirst Trip trophy)
entry.summary:
The Thirst Trip trophy in Life is Strange: Double Exposure requires Max to water both plants in Chapter 2. Gwen will be happy that someone's looking out for her.
Where to water the first of the plants in Life is Strange: Double Exposure
During the second chapter of Life is Strange: Double Exposure in the scene "By The Horns," you can water Gwen's plant in her office. Press the right shoulder button on your controller or the spacebar on your keyboard to skip through the lengthy cutscenes if you've finished this portion of the game. Gwen's office is located in the Fines Arts Building (FAB). After she gets kicked out by the security guard, sneak inside her office. Go into the Dead reality.
Screenshot by Destructoid
In the right-hand corner of the room, you'll see a shriveled-up plant by the fish tank. It's under the flyer and her posters of Remember and The Flaming Mermaids. You're given an option to water the plant.
Where to water Max's plant
Also in the second chapter Penumbra, you'll have a chance to water Max's plant in her house. Head to the Photo Finished scene at the end of the chapter. Don't get distracted by the cat or the evidence. Instead, go to the Massive Plant in the left-hand corner of the room, next to the windows and poetry books.
Screenshot by Destructoid
Select "Water" to finish the task and get the Thirst Trip trophy or achievement. You're one step closer to the platinum! You can finish other tasks like solving the Abraxas puzzle box and reading all the Platypus messages.
The post How to water both plants in Life is Strange: Double Exposure (Thirst Trip trophy) appeared first on Destructoid.

entry.title: Inside Snap Tap, the new hotness keyboard feature outlawed by Valve
entry.summary: The gaming keyboard market is currently tripping over itself, trying to equip everything with the technology most commonly known as Snap Tap: a feature that promises hyperfast inputs of two alternating keypresses, making you an unkillable side-strafing blur in your FPS of choice. Introduced on Razer‚Äôs Huntsman V3 Pro series and quickly followed by Wooting‚Äôs (functionally distinct but effectively identical) Rappy Snappy, Snap Tap is now wearing multiple names as it takes over the world of RGB peripherals, from SteelSeries‚Äô Rapid Tap to Corsair‚Äôs FlashTap and Keychron‚Äôs... Last Keystroke Prioritisation. Which doesn‚Äôt sound as sexy, but still. However, Snap Tap is also drawing a level of ire that exceeds the usual baseline scepticism of hardware marketing. Because it enables a form of input automation ‚Äì where you can quickly move in two directions by rapidly tapping one key, while holding down another ‚Äì it‚Äôs considered by some as tantamount to cheating, allowing players to cross the line that divides unfair play from the accepted comforts that come with simply using a responsive Hall Effect keyboard or high-refresh-rate monitor. It‚Äôs even become a bannable offence in certain games, most notably in Counter-Strike 2. Neither side is backing down; in an astonishingly worded tweet, Wooting went as far as to concede Snap Tap "should be considered cheating. But if it‚Äôs allowed, you need it." But do you? Read more

Microsoft and Xbox have been weirdly missing from the world of handheld gaming: Nintendo basically pioneered the market with the Game Boy line, and later revolutionized it with the DS and 3DS, while Sony found varying levels of success with the PlayStation Portable and its successor, the Vita.

entry.title: Overwatch 2 Mid-Season 13 Twitch Drops: All rewards and how to unlock
entry.summary:
Twitch drops are a favorite among community members for pretty much every game, mostly because they're free! Overwatch 2 isn‚Äôt an exception, as Mid-Season 13 Twitch Drops is released. This article will provide you with everything you need to know about the Season 13 Twitch Drops of Overwatch 2.¬†
Overwatch 2 Mid-Season 13 Twitch Drops rewards
There are four rewards that you snag in Mid-Season 13 Twitch Drops. Here are the rewards:
Ringleader Spray
Ringleader Player Icon
Ringleader Name Card
Ringleader Reaper Epic Skin
How to get the Overwatch 2 Mid-Season 13 Twitch Drops
Before we dive in, you have to connect your Battle.net ID with your Twitch account. To do that, follow these steps:
Step 1: Open the official Battle.net website and login with your account that is linked with the game.
Step 2: Once logged in, go to the connections page and select Twitch to connect your account.
Step 3: Now sign in with your Twitch account and link with your Battle.net ID.
Once linked, now head to the Overwatch 2 directory and watch any streams that have mentioned drops in their title. Here is the list of all required watch time for snagging Twitch Drops:
Ringleader Spray: You have to watch the stream for a total of seven hours.
Ringleader Player Icon: You have to watch the stream for a total of four hours.
Ringleader Name Card: You have to watch the stream for a total of 11 hours.
Ringleader Reaper Epic Skin: You have to watch the stream for a total of 15 hours.
Overwatch 2 Mid-Season 13 Twitch Drops available regions
Here is the list of available regions that can snag the Twitch Drops:
North America
Latin America
Europe
Middle East
Africa
South Korea
Japan
Taiwan
Southeast Asia
Australia
New Zealand
What is the end date of Overwatch 2 Mid-Season 13 Twitch Drops?
The Twitch Drops have already been released and will wrap up on November 22, 2024.
The post Overwatch 2 Mid-Season 13 Twitch Drops: All rewards and how to unlock appeared first on Destructoid.

entry.title: Review: LEGO Horizon Adventures (Switch) - A Beautiful But Basic Build Of Sony's Series

In a situation that echoes the reveal and subsequent Switch launch of Ori and the Blind Forest from Microsoft, we admit to feeling a tad shocked at the revelation that Sony‚Äôs LEGO Horizon Adventures would not just be released on PS5 and Windows, but also Nintendo‚Äôs humble hybrid. Sure, this isn‚Äôt the full-fat Horizon experience ‚Äì PlayStation and PC owners keep that to themselves for the time being ‚Äì but it‚Äôs comfortably the closest we‚Äôve come to Sony migrating its first-party lineup over to another major console platform. The result is a mixed bag. Lego Horizon Adventures starts as an incredibly fun, visually arresting dive into Guerrilla Games' flagship franchise; one that benefits from a more playful tone compared to the series proper, with faithful elements that will please fans of Aloy and Lego alike. But it‚Äôs also quite a shallow, repetitive game that leans heavily on a rather basic structure, with dull level design and severely limited stealth elements putting a dampener on the experience. entry.title: Review: Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake (Switch) - Square Doesn't Drop The Ball, Just Some Frames
entry.summary: The wait is finally over. A few years ago, Square Enix announced it would be doing a remake of Dragon Quest III in its popular HD-2D engine, but this was then followed by a lengthy period of radio silence where its development status seemed uncertain. While they were at it, the developers decided to go ahead and remake the first and second Dragon Quests, too. Now that Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake is finally here, we‚Äôre happy to report that the wait has been well worth it. Though it isn‚Äôt without drawbacks, this is easily the most feature-rich and enjoyable version of Dragon Quest III available. Released in Japan in 1988, Dragon Quest III hails from a much simpler era, so the narrative is considerably less detailed than one you may find in a title from subsequent decades. You begin as a nameless warrior, the child of a once-legendary hero, now called upon to take up your father‚Äôs mantle and save the world from the threat of an evil dark lord. There‚Äôs not much character development to speak of, nor narrative depth‚Äîyour character is essentially a blank slate and your party members are basically animated cardboard cutouts with some stats and gear attached. Though there are ultimately some clever tie-ins to other releases in the series and some new cutscenes to flesh out your father‚Äôs role, the plot amounts to little more than 'there‚Äôs a bad dude out there; go get him!' Read the full article on nintendolife.com

entry.title: Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake review: a world in the palm of your hand
entry.summary: Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake's premise is bluntly, delightfully simple. The Archfiend Baramos, as evil as he is mysterious, is up and about. He‚Äôs got ill designs on the world. Your Dad tried to stop him, and he died. He fell into a volcano. We absolutely can‚Äôt be having that. This is, more than anything else, a game about Going On An Adventure. Well walked ground, of course, but it‚Äôs rare to see it embarked upon with such barefaced delight, or such a wholehearted commitment to going the distance. It is a very big and a very simple RPG that is as wide as an ocean and as deep as a pond; a game to curl up with and play lazily and‚Äîwith some sour caveats‚Äîenjoyably, for an entire winter. Read more

entry.title: Early Benchmarks: AMD EPYC 9005 Performance & Power Efficiency To Lead Further With Linux 6.13
entry.summary: One of the many changes to look forward to with the upcoming Linux 6.13 kernel cycle is the AMD P-State driver to be used by default with the new EPYC 9005 series processors. While AMD Ryzen CPUs for a while now have been defaulting to the modern AMD P-State driver that makes use of ACPI CPPC platform support for allowing better power efficiency, AMD EPYC CPUs have kept to using the generic ACPI CPUFreq frequency scaling driver. But now AMD engineers have deemed amd_pstate ready for use with EPYC 9005 "Turin" CPUs and will be the default choice moving forward. Here is more information and power/performance benchmarks for this shift while testing using the EPYC 9755 processors.

entry.title: The Sunday Papers
entry.summary:
November 8th, 2005 was my first day as a full-time games journalist, which means I have now entered my 20th year of doing this. "This" has changed a lot over time: from producing CD and DVD coverdiscs, to writing for a magazine, to editing magazines and a website, to solely editing a website, to managing several websites. Sprinkle podcasts, videos, events and a lot of other things in there and "games journalist" doesn't really cover it.
One of the only constants is that I read a lot of writing about video games.
Dapper gent Oli Welsh wrote for Polygon about the fan reboot of City Of Heroes. We briefly covered fans getting an official license earlier this year, but Oli went and spoke to the folks making it all work.

entry.title: Rescue your twin from the clutches of the evil Castle Master
entry.summary: Castle Master, the haunting conclusion to the Freescape engine saga, is now ready for public testing! Prepare yourself for a perilous adventure as you lower the drawbridge to enter the Castle Master‚Äôs domain. Released in 1990 by Incentive Software, Castle Master became popular for its technical innovation and challenging gameplay. The game inspired countless 3D adventure titles, and the Freescape engine itself marked a technological milestone, enabling groundbreaking object interaction and spatial puzzles. Notably, Castle Master was one of the first games to let you choose to play as either a prince or a princess, offering a different experience depending on your choice. Your mission: rescue your twin, imprisoned within the eerie depths of Castle Eternity by the evil Magister. This sprawling, foreboding castle is filled with traps, monsters, and puzzles blocking your path. Gather items, unlock doors, and solve complex riddles as you navigate the labyrinthine halls and confront the dark forces within. This modern reimplementation showcases enhanced graphics using OpenGL, with initial support for the DOS and ZX Spectrum releases. If you‚Äôre eager to embark on this dark journey, a playable demo is available to test your tenacity. To participate in the testing, ensure you have a daily development build. We encourage all players to submit feedback and bug reports through our issue tracker. Will you brave the creepy corridors of Castle Eternity and free your sibling, or will you fall victim to the Magister‚Äôs curse and join his army of enslaved spirits? The adventure awaits! >

entry.title: Object-ive Review: Hitman‚Äôs rubber duck
entry.summary: "The cool thing about bombs is that you can hide them in anything," is probably my favourite Oppenheimer quote of all time, and in the case of Ian Hitman, it does raise an important question: with so many everyday objects equal to the rubber duck in its unthreatening aura, yet more inconspicuous, why choose to put an explosive in this one? The simplest answer is that‚Äôs it‚Äôs a recurring bit of levity, a holdover easter egg, elevated to the status of key mission item in Hitman: Codename 47 before being given pride of place as an explosive in the World Of Assassination games. But to ascribe such unassuming purpose to the duck is to ignore its revelatory power. We must go deeper. Read more

entry.title: The co-creator of magic puzzler Hidden Folks is making a sumptuous, spaced-out tower defender
entry.summary: Could tower defence be the ultimate "it's Friday and I am here in body only" genre? I haven't really thought about it before, but Rift Riff's effusively laidback crowd control has me pondering those optimal moments in any tower defender when the incoming horde hits the flamer-MG triangle just right, and you can settle back comfortably into the role of clockwatcher. Rift Riff encourages this behaviour by being nice to look at. Created by a trio of developers including Hidden Folks designer Adriaan de Jongh, it's a world of spacey, sun-carved mountains, forests and monoliths. The towers resemble the sacred architecture of Monument Valley, and the colour scheme and general ambience remind me of Cocoon. There's a demo, if you fancy it. Read more

entry.title: Apex Legends is revisiting the past, but it should be prouder of its present
entry.summary: Nostalgia, when you think about it, is bollocks. There has never been a better time than right this second ‚Äì averaged out, and despite repeated attempts to the contrary, humanity has never been healthier, freer, or more enlightened by knowledge. It‚Äôs true of games too. For every by-committee platter of passionless map markers, there are thousands of more personal, more creative, more interesting works, all adding to the decades' worth of great stuff we can still play today. What isn‚Äôt bollocks is the emotional pull that nostalgia, for all its lack of cold, hard reason, still manages to wield inside our warm, squishy brains. Hence, the centrepiece of Apex Legends‚Äô Season 23 update is a mode that recreates the battle royale FPS as it was back in 2019, defaulting back to the original map and weapon arsenal while cutting the 26-strong legend roster to the earliest ten. It‚Äôs a Fortnite-style rolling back of the clock, and a passably enjoyable one, but also a reminder that the good old days weren‚Äôt always that good. Read more

entry.title: Some guy complained this fishing game only caters to queer players, so the dev added a "straight" title - it costs $9999
entry.summary:

Mostly simple hats and shorts, but some options let players celebrate their sexuality, such as a rainbow-adorned t-shirts, or titles that hang above your character which simply say "Trans" or "Bi". All this led one player to complain there was no "Straight" title. So, the developer added one. It costs 10 grand.

entry.title: GTA 6 release date won't slip to 2026, Take Two assure - they're "highly confident" about fall 2025
entry.summary: A few months ago, the rumour took root that GTA 6's release date would slip back from 2025 to 2026. An anonymous insider averred that studio heads were "worried" about the new open world game's progress - hence, perhaps, Rockstar's decision to mandate a full return to in-office work. Pshaw, say publishers Take-Two CEO. They announced a fall 2025 launch in March and have just doubled down on it in their latest financial briefing, with CEO Strauss Zelnick subsequently going on the tellybox to say that Take-Two are "highly confident in the timing", though he still has nothing to share about GTA 6 on PC. entry.title: Cloudflare to EU: Anti-Piracy Measures Shouldn‚Äôt Harm Privacy and Security
entry.summary: Cloudflare is urging the EU Commission to exclude the company from its upcoming Piracy Watch List, despite requests from several rightsholder groups for its inclusion. The American company says it's committed to addressing piracy concerns but not at the expense of user privacy and security. Instead, the European Commission should ensure that its Piracy Watch List does not become a tool for advocating policy changes. From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.

entry.title: Helldivers 2 boss would "love to do a take" on Star Wars, Predator and Warhammer 40,000

The dominion of hated Super Earth threatens to expand afresh as Arrowhead CEO Johan Pilestedt toys openly with the prospect of Helldivers 2 cross-over games, beginning with tabletop wargame Trench Crusade and extending to, well, take your pick. Arrowhead's appetite for other licenses appears insatiable. It's the kind of sheer expansionism you'd expect from Earth's loathsome regime, whose "managed democracy" propaganda continues to enthrall thousands of hapless disposable imperialists. Pilestedt even wants to make a Fifth Element game! Milla Jovovich is spinning in her grave. Milla Jovovich isn't dead, you say? Well, that's good news at least.

entry.title: Mask Quest review: the cops don't have to breathe
entry.summary:
When I was a competitive long-distance runner at school, breath control was paramount. We were never really taught this, mind. It was an art you picked up through practice: how to breathe before the race, saturating your blood with O2 without dizzying yourself; when to permit the shorter, emergency breaths and when to apply restraint; when to deepen your inhales and charge yourself up for an attack on a hill. And then, how to organise your body around your breath, straightening your posture to expand your lungs without tipping back too far and squandering muscle power; how to breath in time with your stride and the movement of your shoulders, so as to firm up your momentum and shave a miraculous-feeling minute off your finishing time. All this, plus various daft psychological war gambits of my own devising. When overtaking or being overtaken, I used to seal my lips shut on that side and breath through the other corner of my mouth, to make it look like I was hardly out of breath at all.
Read more

entry.title: The Raid homage Acts Of Blood is Sifu‚Äôs jankier, snackier cousin
entry.summary: Calling a game ‚Äòno frills‚Äô or ‚Äòno nonsense‚Äô is always a back-handed compliment, because it sounds like you're saying it's a bit straightforward and simple. And yes, that‚Äôs exactly what I‚Äôm saying here. Acts Of Blood feels like a spiffy PS2 action brawler; a slightly tighter old Yakuza game, or a stripped-back Sifu. It‚Äôs snacky and a bit janky, but it‚Äôs also great coffee break fodder, assuming you want to spend your break breaking a selection of heavy objects over the crumbly skulls of ne‚Äôer-do-wells. I mean, they might have done some things well, I don‚Äôt know them. But they aren‚Äôt doing any well to my character in the game, so violence it is. Read more

entry.title: Alan Wake 2‚Äôs The Lake House is a dark, brilliant parable on the devaluation of art and artists
entry.summary: There must be hundreds of typewriters in the hall, their collective clacks a tidal wave of soulless automation, rising up to greet agent Kiran Estevez as she enters, pistol and flashlight in hands. Exploring rooms to the side, Alan Wake 2: The Lake House‚Äôs star finds whiteboards and documents revealing the typewriter‚Äôs purpose: to mimic Wake‚Äôs writing. Pages are graded along criteria such as ‚Äòstyle‚Äô, ‚Äòtone‚Äô, and ‚Äòcontent‚Äô, then ‚Äúfed into the algorithm‚Äù as references until ‚Äúnear-identical stories‚Äù to Wake‚Äôs can be produced. ‚ÄúIf Jules could simply cut the painter open and pull the painting out of him, he would,‚Äù reads one of the real Alan‚Äôs typewritten pages. That‚Äôs Jules Marmont, the obsessive head of the titular FBC centre. The Marmonts - Jules and his wife Diana - are running experiments to forcibly and synthetically create works of art, aiming to mimic creative passion convincingly enough for the paranatural entity inside Cauldron Lake to respond, as it has in the past. Read more

entry.title: Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater will have new dialogue, and EVA‚Äôs actor reveals why she chose a pseudonym based on her pet dog

Some days, you simply must feast on a tree frog, and while we still don‚Äôt have a solid release date, that day doesn‚Äôt feel too far away. Good news for stealth fans, and perhaps gooder news for a dozen strapline writers sweating profusely, soiling themselves in anticipation of using ‚Äúkept you waiting, huh?‚Äù. Until then, I at least have a steady drip feed of new information to keep me sated, the latest of which is the substantial hint that there'll be some new dialogue in the game, as per the video below. Alongside that, the previously pseudonymous Suzetta Mi√±et - who was credited with voicing EVA in MGS3 and Peace Walker - has revealed herself to be Jodi Benson, the voice of Ariel in Disney‚Äôs The Little Mermaid. entry.title: Buggy monsters in Monster Hunter Wilds have sparked a wave of low-poly animal adoration
entry.summary:
I've spent quite a lot of today trying to figure out why, exactly, some of the monsters in the Monster Hunter Wilds beta looked like bundles of copulating pyramids slathered in crocodile gravy. Nic clued me in on this reddit thread earlier, which cites unnamed Chinese players who've allegedly data-mined the beta's monster models, and learned that they are extremely large, encompassing hundreds of thousands of polygons. If every monster in Monster Hunter Wilds were that fancy all of the time, your computer would become a volcano. As such, the game resorts to loading-on-demand systems to ensure that you only see those gorgeous details when the monsters are close by and, as the case may be, angrily sitting on you. When they're further afield, the flourishes fall away to free up memory and processing power. The popular Redditor explanation for the presence of monsters that look like Henry Moore sculpture is basically that the LOD systems are being forgetful, and neglecting to load the additional polygons at proximity.
Read more

entry.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 campaign review: a military shooter that comes disguised as other, better games
entry.summary: As a yearly blockbuster, Call of Duty, through sheer expense and effort, would like you to think it is the Die Hard of video games. Or, depending on the setting, the Saving Private Ryan of video games. But it is barely Black Hawk Down. This latest campaign in Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 reminds me more of the forgettable Netflix shootfests that thumbnail their way across your TV screen as you try to find some gritty nothing to aid you in zoning out of life. Still, there is an anecdotal contingent of casual sofa sitters for whom Call Of Duty is the game. A balls-to-the-wall shooter to return to every winter and rinse through in a weekend. Ed has already gestured at its multiplayer, announcing: "yup, it's COD", like a deeply tired Captain Birdseye inspecting the day's catch, wondering when his life will change. But never mind that. How does the single player story mode hold up? Some are calling it the best campaign in years. And I guess that's true, in the sense that it is the least worst. Read more

entry.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard is Veil-good on the Steam Deck

Dragon Age: The Veilguard runs like a tap on any halfway decent desktop hardware, so was naturally going to be worth trying on the weaker Deck. And sure enough, Bioware‚Äôs RPG (which is really more of an action game with the occasional verbal spar) settles comfortably into handheld life. In fact, Valve have festooned its Steam page with a Verified medal, a seal of approval for any game that performs and controls well on the Steam Deck without any glaring weaknesses or impractical annoyances. It‚Äôs still worth playing around with the settings ‚Äì more on those later ‚Äì but I‚Äôll back up that official assessment, having played for several hours without so much as an undersized tooltip. Read more

entry.title: Bambas! is Untitled Shoes Game
entry.summary: The trailer for Bambas! starts off innocently enough. It's an "innovative urban walking simulator" in which you play a disembodied pair of shoes, individually moved with a controller's analog sticks and trigger buttons. The first half of the trailer is all whimsy and playground fun - kicking a football, standing on a climbing frame, riding a skateboard. But then a note of darkness creeps in, as the player begins to channel the sheer nihilistic inconsequentiality of a world in which shoes have no thinking human bodies to restrain them. Read more

entry.title: Hori‚Äôs spiritual successor to the Steam Controller is up for preorder on Amazon today
entry.summary: Hori's latest addition to its controller lineup, the "Horipad Wireless for Steam," is now available for preorder on Amazon. After already releasing in Japan at the end of October, now the gamepad is coming to the US. Read more

entry.title: Factorio: Space Age review: a stellar expansion produces a masterful final form
entry.summary: To say that Factorio: Space Age throws out the rulebook is an understatement. It'd be more fitting to say it's somehow automated the whole process: an inserter plucked out the rulebook from my brain and deposited it in hot magma, while a new rulebook was churned out in a nearby machine and plopped into my brain from the other side - only for that to be immediately plucked out and incinerated as well. With each new planet and each new phase, Space Age reinvents itself. I'm battling hyperbole here, but ah hell, I admit defeat. Factorio: Space Age is a masterpiece, the final form of perhaps the most well-crafted building game I'll ever play. Read more

entry.title: This bite-size free horror game has you study an ancient artefact that holds a dark secret
entry.summary: I have zero archaeology experience or knowledge, but I bet archaeologists really love their jobs (for the most part). They get to analyse and discover cool artefacts and educate us on the histories of forgotten civilisations. That's dreamy stuff, that is. But I do wonder what it's like for archaeologists to discover and study something they shouldn't have; something with a disturbing secret - a curse, maybe. Bite-sized horror game The Children Of Clay explores this idea and I'd like more of it, please. Read more

entry.title: Here‚Äôs a new launch trailer for Attenborough-em-up RTS Empire Of The Ants, out this week
entry.summary: Much the same as anyone with a soul, I find ants deeply fascinating and, much the same as anyone who occasionally drops small pieces of sandwich on the floor, I will continue to uphold my respect for them as long as they come nowhere near my feet. Yes. I admit it: I am a bug hypocrite, loudly extolling their virtue and beauty at a distance then getting irritated if they decide to come sit on me. Fortunately, real time strategy Empire Of The Ants understands that the best place for insects to be is inside a screen, where they can be appreciated but cannot under any circumstances touch you. It‚Äôs out this week, as it happens, and here‚Äôs a new launch trailer to celebrate. Follow your pheromone trail to the video below. Read more

entry.title: Black Ops 6 devs still looking into unfair spawning - "yes, we saw ourselves in a Killcam before selecting a Loadout too"
entry.summary:
Early reactions to Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 multiplayer range from frothing dislike through omnimovement hype to our own Ed Thorn's dead-eyed appraisal that it's "a good one, I think. Not a bad one. If you like Call Of Duty, you will like this. If you don't like Call Of Duty, you will not like this." I feel like we need to emergency-deploy a supply crate of smelling salts, because the sheer OK-ness of Black Ops 6 appears to have tumbled Ed into a stupor.
Perhaps it would be a different story if he'd encountered some of the spawning issues and glitches people are talking about, with players joining games and materialising right into a hail of fire. The players in question include Black Ops 6's developers, who comically note in the latest Black Ops 6 patch notes that "Yes, we saw ourselves in a Killcam before selecting a Loadout too." The latest patch seeks to address this, naturally. As regards the campaign side of things, it also resets your safehouse currency to 5000, if you've had your single player funds stolen (or multiplied) by technical gremlins.

entry.title: Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3's reactivity didn‚Äôt ruin Veilguard's linearity for me - it let me enjoy it more
entry.summary: Minor spoilers for the first few hours of Veilguard and heavy spoilers for Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3 For all the things I ended up enjoying about Dragon Age: The Veilguard, it isn‚Äôt much of an RPG. What little roleplaying it does offer revolves around what flavour of supportive hero you prefer, and you can count the number of impactful dialogue decisions on a three-fingered hand. This might sound utterly damning in the wake of Baldur's Gate 3‚Äôs incredible reactivity, and if I approached games as some sort of tedious comparative intellectual exercise rather than just, y‚Äôknow, seeing how I felt about them, then I suppose it would be. Weirdly, though, the recent memory of Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3 didn‚Äôt diminish my time with Veilguard at all. It was actually the opposite: it freed Dragon Age from having to carry the torch for a certain period in Bioware‚Äôs history, and let me enjoy Veilguard for what it was. Read more

entry.title: Twitch introduce mandatory "Politics and Sensitive Social Issues" label, just in time for the US election
entry.summary:
Twitch have introduced a new "Politics and Sensitive Social Issues" label for streams that "focus" on topics like "elections, civic integrity, and war or military conflict". As with the streaming giant's existing labels for M-rated material, sexual themes or depictions of gambling, the idea is that viewers can filter out such streams in advance by altering their settings. Advertisers, similarly, can "make better choices about the content they want to advertise next to" - in other words, pull their ads from a whole swathe of material if they don't want to be associated with anything controversial. Twitch's hope is that "the labels will allow advertisers to have more context to inform which types of streams they show their ads alongside, which we expect to increase brands‚Äô confidence in running ads on Twitch, and could bring new advertisers to our service."
Read more

entry.title: Straftat review: an anarchic First-Person Speed dater you'll fall in love with
entry.summary: It‚Äôs tempting to frame Straftat as a throwback to an older, better time for the multiplayer FPS, when the lingo was coded in frags and gibs and sucking it down, when satisfaction was drawn entirely from performance rather than some convoluted, artificial system of progression. Not only would this be inaccurate, but it would also do a disservice to what Straftat truly is, namely a wild overcorrection in response to the direction of modern multiplayer gunfests, one that careens straight through retro stations to arrive somewhere new and exciting. Read more

entry.title: We‚Äôve learned the hard way that ganging up on Deadlock doesn‚Äôt make it more digestible
entry.summary: The mystery surrounding Deadlock, Valve‚Äôs work-in-progress MOBA shooter, has largely evaporated. Its freely extendable invite system is about as effective at controlling player headcount as a disinterested football steward, meaning pretty much anyone with a clued-in Steam friend can get in and start poking around its secrets. And yet, being a lane-pushing wizard fighter in the Dota 2 vein, it‚Äôs already a vast tangle of interplaying abilities, items, strats, and often unspoken rules, of the kind that even experienced gankists will take hundreds of hours to learn. It‚Äôs been too much for poor Brendy, at any rate. Still, Brendy is but one man. What if we had but four men, working in tandem to crush lanes and flatten Patrons just as Gabe intended? To find out if Deadlock is indeed more comprehensible as a team sport, Graham, Ed, Ollie, and James joined forces, promptly getting fucked up yet emerging from the warlock hospital with a deeper understanding of its workings. Or, at least, if anyone would keep playing. Read more

entry.title: The Forever Winter devs answer complaints about water scarcity... by adding thieves who invade your HQ and steal your water
entry.summary: When nightmarish sci-fi extraction shooter The Forever Winter launched into early access in September it was somewhat messy. Bugs and maddening enemy spawns diminished the tension of being a fleshy human scavenger in a mech battlefield. But one feature annoyed some players much more - fresh water. See, you need to keep your headquarters stocked with water, as it gets steadily used by your settlement's inhabitants. The catch being that this water diminishes even while you're not playing the game. If it runs out completely, then everything you've collected gets wiped. The developers have listened to complaints about this most Farmville of mechanics, and they've answered in an interesting way. Water thieves! Now, on top of the usual downward trickle, burglars will come to steal your H2O as well. It's not as bad as it sounds. Read more

entry.title: Piracy Shield Crisis Erupts as AGCOM Board Member Slams Huge Toll on Resources
entry.summary: Critics of Italy's Piracy Shield are not difficult to find but, with its powerful and influential proponents rarely far away, getting heard is a considerable challenge. Not to mention getting anything done. After calling for the platform's suspension and meeting resistance in the wake of the recent Google Drive blocking blunder, AGCOM board member Elisa Giomi has gone public with a laundry list of concerns. It pulls zero punches. From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.

entry.title: It's never too early in the week to play 4D minigolf
entry.summary: I didn't sleep last night for entirely self-inflicted reasons and my brain feels like that one accursed hoover bag you refuse to empty, because there is no way of doing so that won't turn the neighbourhood into Silent Hill. I need to avoid any complicated write-ups, or my brain will detonate similarly and paint north London grey. Ah, a minigolf game! I think I can just about hack the concept of minigolf, on this most desperate of Mondays. It is golf but mini. Bonzai golf. Digestible! Intuitive! Why, I've managed to write 100 words without even looking at the Steam page. Let's do so now. Wait a minute, this isn't minigolf. It's Mini Mini Golf Golf. What is Mini Mini Golf Golf? "Destabilize the present and plunge into a neon psychohistory of a bizarre entity in distress," the Steam page explains. "This is not a game about minigolf." It is too late to flee. Read more

entry.title: Slitterhead review: body-hopping action horror that's best left dispossessed
entry.summary: I was excited for Slitterhead, an action adventure game by Bokeh Studio, a studio founded by none other than your boy Keiichiro Toyama: the creator of Silent Hill, Gravity Rush, and the Siren series. And within that first hour, Slitterhead's body-possessing and Hong Kong-inspired streets had me thinking, "Is this it, the sleeper hit of 2024?!" No, sadly not. It's no doubt built a compelling universe filled with brain-sucking aliens that masquerade as humans, and it attempts plenty else besides: bouncing between bodies as you stealth around dingy apartment blocks, fighting with blood katanas, and gorging on pools of red plasma to refuel skills, many of which require more body-flitting. Thing is, they are ultimately just attempts, attempts that fall victim to an emptiness and jitteriness that quickly reveals Slitterhead's true, irritating form. Read more

entry.title: No, you're not imagining Monster Hunter Wilds' beta combat feeling off - there's a good reason for it
entry.summary: I didn‚Äôt get much further in the extremely popular beta for the haute-couture-asaurus action of Monster Hunter Wilds than perfecting the exact orange-to-white ratio of my cat. Not because I wasn‚Äôt having fun, but because I immediately started looking up GPU prices after playing for ten minutes. As such, I didn‚Äôt spend enough time with the combat to get a proper feel for it. Cultural osmosis has once again allowed me to form an uneducated take, however, and I‚Äôm getting the sense there‚Äôs been some mixed reactions re: bonk quality. According to a clip shared on X by user Blue Stigma, there's a good reason for those misgivings. It's all about frames, you see. Read more

entry.title: Thysiastery is an anime Legend Of Grimrock, and you can attack the dinosaur merchants if you‚Äôre a complete monster
entry.summary: One of my lesser quality tests for an RPG is whether the shopkeepers complain at you for not buying anything. Grumpy shopkeepers, good RPG. This most specific of litmus tests has served me well, although I must admit that I‚Äôd happily upgrade it to ‚Äòshopkeepers you can attack‚Äô, would that not disqualify 99% of games. But not turn based dungeon crawler Thysiastery, it turns out. This ‚Äúdungeon crawler RPG featuring traditional roguelike and turn-based gameplay‚Äù apparently trusts you enough to let you recklessly batter its friendly wandering lizard merchants. You‚Äôd be a monster for it, of course, but it‚Äôs nice to have options. Read more

entry.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows will reboot Assassin's Creed's patchy modern-day story
entry.summary: Put your hand up if you'd forgotten that every Assassin's Creed game is, strictly speaking, set in the present day. I know I had. That's not the actual distant past you're parkouring through. That isn't actual Renaissance architecture you're clambering on. It's a holographic Animus simulation, conjured from ancestral memories flash-frozen within your DNA - convenient, inasmuch as it means that any inconsistencies are your DNA's fault, not Ubisoft's. If the ledge-mantling animations are glitchy, that's simply because you have bad genes. We can both be forgiven for losing sight of Assassin's Creed's modern day narrative frame. Ubisoft themselves have downplayed it since the era of Desmond Miles, the watery Peter Parker figure who served as puppetmaster protagonist for AC games up to Assassin's Creed 3. In Assassin's Creed Shadows, however, they're planning to bring back the modern day setting in a big way, though details are scanty. Read more

entry.summary:
It's official: I am once again the Sunday correspondent around here. That means it falls to me to round up (mostly) good (mostly) writing about (mostly) video games. I will otherwise be spending my Sunday continuing the fight against my dog's fleas, which rebound every three weeks no matter how much I spray, scrub or throw things away. The Elder Scrolls: Legends, the free-to-play card game set in Bethesda's fantasy world, has been removed from sale on Steam. Its servers will shut down for good on January 30th, 2025, after which it will no longer be playable. The closure comes five years after the game was last updated.

entry.title: Typing Of The Dead meets Resident Evil with co-op in Blood Typers, which has a demo you can play now
entry.summary:
Typing Of The Dead released in arcades 25 years ago remains a masterpiece - funny, absurd, tense, and novel. I am keen on any game that aims to follow in its footsteps, and there are a few. The latest is Blood Typers, a horror game where you tippity-tap on your keyboard to fight montsters in a spooky mansion, but this isn't a rail shooter, so you'll be typing to explore and navigate, too.
It's now got a release of February 2025, and there's a demo you can play now.

entry.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 multiplayer review: it's like Call Of Duty
entry.summary: People have asked me, a Call Of Duty liker, "How's the new COD?" - such is the mass appeal of Call Of Duty that even a lot of my non-industry pals are invested in whether Black Ops 6's shooty really does bang. And every single time my brain clunks into gear and I turn inwards, where I struggle to come up with anything meaningful to say. So much so that a fog develops and out of the fog emerges a figure - it's me. I'm holding an M4A1 with an extended barrel and a vertical foregrip. My brain and body perform a pincer movement of physical response: 1) I shrug 2) I say, "It's like Call Of Duty". Read more

entry.summary:

By which I mean, the Monster Hunter Wilds beta is now live on Steam through to 4th November at 2.59am GMT. That's 2.59am sharp. entry.title: Alan Wake 2 still hasn't quite made its money back, according to Remedy's latest financials
entry.summary:
Remedy's Alan Wake 2 has now "recouped most of its development and marketing expenses", CEO Tero Virtala has announced in a business review for January-September 2024. Speaking as somebody who would quite like there to be more Alan Wake games - or at least, moderately weird and pretty decent blockbuster singleplayer horror games - I am both pleased by this news and a little troubled that Remedy's eldritch forest fable (which came out in October 2023) has yet to break even.
Read more

entry.title: I don't need to remind you that this investigation is strictly unofficial
entry.summary: We are excited to announce that Rise of the Dragon is now ready for public testing. This is the first of a small number of games built using the DGDS (Dynamix Game Development System) engine. The Dynamix name may be familiar ‚Äì bought by Sierra in 1990, the Dynamix brand continued and became well known for action and puzzle games like The Incredible Machine, A10 Tank Killer, and Red Baron. They also made a few adventures using the custom DGDS engine. Rise of the Dragon is set in Los Angeles in a dark version of the future, circa 2053. You play as Blade Hunter, a private investigator and retired police officer. After a designer drug kills the mayor's rebellious daughter, Chandra, Hunter is hired to find the people responsible for releasing the drug on the streets. What Blade ultimately finds is much more than he expected. Rise of the Dragon combines classic point-and-click adventure style with platforming arcade sequences, giving a unique gameplay combination. You‚Äôll need the latest daily build of ScummVM and files from the DOS version of the game, which you can buy at GOG (check our wiki for the required data files). Please file any issues you notice on our bug tracker. >

entry.title: ‚ÄúCan you bring peace to.. UNREST?‚Äù
entry.summary: Unrest is a roleplaying game developed by Pyrodactyl Studios set in a fantasy interpretation of ancient India. You‚Äôll step into the shoes of ordinary people and navigate a world fraught with challenges as they strive for safety, freedom, and peace. We are proud to announce that Unrest is now playable using ScummVM thanks to the work done by our GSoC student, Kartik Agarwala! Help us test the game by grabbing a daily build of ScummVM. Read through our testing guidelines, and please take some screenshots along the way. If you encounter any issues, please report them to our bugtracker. If you don‚Äôt own Unrest, you can purchase this game from either GOG or Steam. The demo for the game is also supported and available from our web site. Now go, use your manipulative skills to bring peace to this troubled world where chaos is not afar. For the most daring players using the iron-man mode, saving and loading the game is only available using ScummVM's Global Main Menu. >
